issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create security group allowing icmp and ssh from 0.0.0.0/0
2. Create another security group with the same protocol settings except select the first group from the drop down list to allow traffic from
3. Launch 2 instances and assign 1 to each group
4. You should be able to login to the instance assigned to the group in step 1.
5. From there, attempt to ping the second instance

Expected results: You will not be able to ping the second instance.  Also the shell output of 'euca-describe-groups' will be missing the USER number information.

If I do the same experiment but use the CLI to create the groups and permissions, the instances can communicate and there are no log errors.

Output from CLI with missing USER number:
{code}
[root@g-26-05 ui-test-acct-00]# euca-describe-groups
GROUP	sg-27362b36	310744350460	sec-group-1	test
PERMISSION	310744350460	sec-group-1	ALLOWS	icmp	8	8	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	310744350460	sec-group-1	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
GROUP	sg-c6cf361a	310744350460	default	default group
GROUP	sg-1356a8f5	310744350460	sec-group-2	test
PERMISSION	310744350460	sec-group-2	ALLOWS	icmp	8	8	FROM	USER		ID	sg-27362b36	ingress
PERMISSION	310744350460	sec-group-2	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	USER		ID	sg-27362b36	ingress
{code}

Log Error:
{code}

fields.summary: Instances unable to communicate with each other when assigned to linked security groups

comments.body: Is this enough of a corner case that we can push to 4.1? I think so.
[~jloza] Workaround to this bug is adding rules for IP/port directly.

I just tried this and here's what I get in the group via euca2ools after setting up the ssh and ICMP rules in the console:

GROUP	sg-58706fcc	875578653920	default	default group	
PERMISSION	875578653920	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	USER	875578653920	ID	sg-4ce0d296	ingress
PERMISSION	875578653920	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	USER	875578653920	ID	sg-89317149	ingress
PERMISSION	875578653920	default	ALLOWS	icmp	0	65535	FROM	USER	875578653920	ID	sg-89317149	ingress

[~ccassler], can you verify this is still an issue in develop?
[~ccassler], please verify if this is still an issue.

[~jloza]: This is no longer an issue in version:
{code}
[root@h-07 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.4848.248.20141126git9b41451.el6   Build Date: Wed 26 Nov 2014 05:33:40 PM PST
Install Date: Mon 01 Dec 2014 09:51:34 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-26-118-72
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.0-0.0.4848.248.20141126git9b41451.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 10495650                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
{code}
